intro: Hieracium planchonianum var. chalybaeum, commonly known as the Chalybaeum hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It has a taproot system and produces achenes as its seeds. This variety is native to Europe and is often found in temperate climates.
